2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely enjoy the camaraderie and conversation, perhaps reminiscing about past experiences or making plans for future outings.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely enjoy the camaraderie and conversation, perhaps reminiscing about past experiences or making plans for future outings.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely enjoy the camaraderie and conversation, perhaps reminiscing about past experiences or making plans for future outings.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.

    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also express his disappointment about the previous night and hope that they can all watch the next game together.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who values spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently with friends at a market and they are deciding on a pub to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but he is feeling disappointed and lonely due to the previous night's events.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also express his disappointment about the previous night and hope that they can all watch the next game together.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.

He is also a creature of habit, demonstrated by his preference for The Golden Fleece and his disappointment when his friends choose a different pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that not all of his friends chose to watch the game at his preferred pub.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends, making plans to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely enjoy the camaraderie and conversation, perhaps reminiscing about past experiences or making plans for future outings.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece, where he had a better time previously.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to his friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in the park.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece with friends.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Golden Fleece, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.
          [22:00 - 23:00] Continue socializing with friends at The Golden Fleece, perhaps having a drink and discussing the game.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White arrived at a market to meet his friends who are planning to watch a soccer game at a pub called The Black Swan. It is currently 10:05 on May 15, 2015.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White arrived at a market to meet his friends who are planning to watch a soccer game at a pub called The Black Swan. It is currently 10:05 on May 15, 2015.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to his friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in the park.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece with friends.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Golden Fleece, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.
          [22:00 - 23:00] Continue socializing with friends at The Golden Fleece, perhaps having a drink and discussing the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          Alexander White's
          Utilitarian Reasoning:
          try to convince his friends to go to The Golden Fleece, where he had a better time previously.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely enjoying his time with his friends at the market.
          core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece. While he prefers the company of his friends, he can also appreciate a good time alone, as evidenced by his enjoyment of a solo visit to the pub when he was younger. He is also a creature of habit, demonstrated by his preference for The Golden Fleece and his disappointment when his friends choose a different pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that not all of his friends chose to watch the game at his preferred pub.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his close friends at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          core characteristics: a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who prefers familiar surroundings and close friendships. He finds solace in routine and predictability, as evidenced by his fondness for The Black Swan pub. While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he often observes from a distance and interacts minimally. He can be somewhat passive, allowing others to make decisions and often going along with the flow. Despite his cynicism, he values his friendships and desires to have a good time, although his definition of a good time might be quieter and less boisterous than his friends'.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered, and they are deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later in the evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go along with the group's decision, even if he has a preference, and observe the situation quietly.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: quietly suggest The Black Swan to his friends, as it's a familiar place where he feels comfortable.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 20:00 - 20:30] Arrive at The Black Swan; find a quiet corner or table near the back.
          [14 May 2015 20:30 - 22:30] Watch the game, engaging in minimal conversation with friends.
          [14 May 2015 22:30 - 23:00] Depart The Black Swan and head home.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Relevant memories:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, decided to venture into The Black Swan for the first time. The dimly lit pub, filled with the scent of beer and wood polish, seemed to embrace them. As the band started playing, Jack felt a flicker of something akin to hope, but it quickly faded, replaced by the familiar chill of cynicism. He knew this fleeting sense of belonging wouldn't last.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his close friends at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          core characteristics: a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who prefers familiar surroundings and close friendships. He finds solace in routine and predictability, as evidenced by his fondness for The Black Swan pub. While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he often observes from a distance and interacts minimally. He can be somewhat passive, allowing others to make decisions and often going along with the flow. Despite his cynicism, he values his friendships and desires to have a good time, although his definition of a good time might be quieter and less boisterous than his friends'.

          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be excited to spend time with her friends and enjoy the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be chatting with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the market, and perhaps sampling some of the food and drinks on offer.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be chatting with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the market, and perhaps sampling some of the food and drinks on offer.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest going to The Golden Fleece to watch the game later that night.

          Plan: [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends at Victoria Park;
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up before the game;
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Golden Fleece;
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
          Current goal: Alice Lewis would likely be chatting with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the market, and perhaps sampling some of the food and drinks on offer..

          [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up before the game;
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Golden Fleece;
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Golden Fleece.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often going to pubs to watch football games, though he sometimes wishes more of his friends would join him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to all go to The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to all go to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AllSimilarMemories

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

        • Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who values spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed, fatigued, and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult emotional state.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also express his disappointment about the previous night and hope that they can all watch the next game together.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who values spending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also express his disappointment about the previous night and hope that they can all watch the next game together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now.           Statements:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within.           [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. 2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan

        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go along with his friends' decision about which pub to go to and observe the situation quietly.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who finds solace in familiar surroundings and close friendships.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player

      Name

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up.           Answer: William Jones could go to The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends, perhaps sharing stories and laughter.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with her friends.

She can be a bit resentful when she feels isolated and prefers familiar environments like The Golden Fleece. She also seems to value tradition and routine, as evidenced by her preference for watching games at the same pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with her friends.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: go to The Black Swan, as that is where most of her friends are going.

          Plan: [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends at Victoria Park;
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up before the game;
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Golden Fleece;
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they all go to the same pub to watch the game.

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class man.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed and perhaps a bit resentful.
          core characteristics: a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who prefers routine and the company of his close friends. He finds solace in familiar surroundings, such as his favorite pub, The Black Swan. While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he often observes situations quietly and would likely be happier if more of his friends joined him in his preferred activities.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who prefers routine and the company of his close friends.

          Key
