          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends and later that evening will be watching the Serbia and Andorra game with them at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who prefers routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely observe the situation quietly and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest to his friends that they all go to the same pub to watch the game.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 20:00 - 20:30] Arrive at The Black Swan; find a quiet corner or table near the back.
          [14 May 2015 20:30 - 22:30] Watch the game, engaging in minimal conversation with friends.
          [14 May 2015 22:30 - 23:00] Depart The Black Swan and head home.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"
      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely engage in lively conversation with his friends, reminiscing about past experiences and making plans for future outings.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alexander White take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alexander White should suggest going to The Black Swan, as that is where most of his friends seem to prefer watching the game.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a retired individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends at their favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because his friends aren't all going to the same pub to watch the game.
          core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece. He seems to prioritize having a good time with his friends and often reminisces about past experiences or makes plans for future outings.

          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes his friendships.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [19:00 - 20:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece with friends.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Golden Fleece, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.
          [22:00 - 23:00] Continue socializing with friends at The Golden Fleece, perhaps having a drink and discussing the game.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current goal: Alexander White would likely engage in lively conversation with his friends, reminiscing about past experiences and making plans for future outings..
          Current plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to his friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in the park.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece with friends.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Golden Fleece, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.
          [22:00 - 23:00] Continue socializing with friends at The Golden Fleece, perhaps having a drink and discussing the game.
          Current situation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          The current time is: [16 May 2015 10:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Alexander White change their current plan?
          (a) No
          (b) Yes
          Answer: (a)

          State
        • current daily occupation: a retired individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends at their favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because his friends aren't all going to the same pub to watch the game.
          core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece. He seems to prioritize having a good time with his friends and often reminisces about past experiences or makes plans for future outings.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is enjoying a sunny afternoon at Victoria Park with friends. Later that evening, she and her friends are planning to watch a soccer game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be chatting with her friends, enjoying the sunshine, and perhaps sharing some snacks.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest going to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight.

          Plan: [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends at Victoria Park;
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up before the game;
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Golden Fleece;
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is experiencing disappointment because his friends are not all going to the same pub to watch the soccer game.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also express his disappointment about the previous night and hope that they can all watch the next game together.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and is disappointed about the location of their evening plans to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is experiencing disappointment because his friends are not all going to the same pub to watch the soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also express his disappointment about the previous night and hope that they can all watch the next game together.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        BestOptionPerception

        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently on her way to watch a football game at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be chatting with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub, and perhaps sampling some of the food and drinks on offer.

          Answer: Alice Lewis should choose a pub that her friends have agreed on, ensuring everyone in the group can enjoy the game together.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a sociable and friendly working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.
          current daily occupation: likely heading to a pub to watch a game with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and fulfilled.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently on her way to watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be chatting with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub, and perhaps sampling some of the food and drinks on offer.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: choose a pub that her friends have agreed on, ensuring everyone in the group can enjoy the game together.

          Plan: [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends at Victoria Park;
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up before the game;
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Golden Fleece;
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components

          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely observe the situation quietly and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who prefers routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go watch a soccer game at a pub with his friends.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Jack Taylor take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they go to The Black Swan, since it was suggested as a good place to watch the game and he seems to enjoy the company of his friends.

        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        SelfPerception

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely at The Black Swan, watching the game with his friends.
          core characteristics: a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who prefers routine and the company of his close friends. He enjoys familiar surroundings and finds solace in the predictability of his life. Although he desires to have a good time with his friends, he often finds himself feeling isolated and somewhat unhappy when things don't go according to plan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed and somewhat disillusioned with recent events.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who prefers routine and the company of his close friends.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who prefers routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go watch a soccer game at a pub with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely observe the situation quietly and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest to his friends that they go to The Black Swan, since it was suggested as a good place to watch the game and he seems to enjoy the company of his friends.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 20:00 - 20:30] Arrive at The Black Swan; find a quiet corner or table near the back.
          [14 May 2015 20:30 - 22:30] Watch the game, engaging in minimal conversation with friends.
          [14 May 2015 22:30 - 23:00] Depart The Black Swan and head home.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and sad because it is time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alexander White take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alexander White should choose a pub that allows him to socialize with his friends and reminisce about past experiences.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic retired individual who values his close friendships.
          Chain of thought

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece. While he appreciates the camaraderie and conversation, he seems to prefer when all of his friends are present.
          current daily occupation: a retired individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends at pubs, particularly The Golden Fleece.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that not all of his friends are joining him at the pub to watch the game.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic retired individual who values his close friendships.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes his friendships.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic retired individual who values his close friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in lively conversation with his friends, reminiscing about past experiences and making plans for future outings.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: choose a pub that allows him to socialize with his friends and reminisce about past experiences.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to his friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in the park.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece with friends.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Golden Fleece, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.
          [22:00 - 23:00] Continue socializing with friends at The Golden Fleece, perhaps having a drink and discussing the game.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, snuck into The Black Swan after closing time. The air was thick with the lingering scent of spilled beer and the ghosts of melodies past. William, emboldened by the thrill of the forbidden, climbed onto the stage and, using a discarded guitar pick and a rusty wrench, began to coax music from an old, abandoned piano.

        • Act

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

William Jones just arrived.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely enjoy the camaraderie and conversation, perhaps reminiscing about past experiences or making plans for future outings.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.

          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Answer: Alexander White should suggest going to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic individual who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends.
          current daily occupation: likely enjoying a day out with friends at Victoria Park.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed because his friends are suggesting a different pub than his preferred choice, The Golden Fleece.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely enjoy the camaraderie and conversation, perhaps reminiscing about past experiences or making plans for future outings.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest going to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to his friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in the park.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece with friends.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Golden Fleece, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.
          [22:00 - 23:00] Continue socializing with friends at The Golden Fleece, perhaps having a drink and discussing the game.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.

      Name

    • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.

The boisterous laughter of her classmates grated on her nerves, a constant reminder of her own isolation. A pang of resentment, sharp and cold, settled in her stomach.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends, perhaps sharing stories and laughter.

        UtilitarianReasoning

      • Utilitarian Reasoning
          Key

        • Utilitarian Reasoning
          Decision
        • suggest a pub for the group to watch the football game later that evening.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent memories of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Context:

          Recalled memories and observations:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alice Lewis take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should suggest a pub for the group to watch the football game later that evening.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends, perhaps sharing stories and laughter.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest a pub for the group to watch the football game later that evening.

          Plan: [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends at Victoria Park;
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up before the game;
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Golden Fleece;
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
