          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.

      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he watched as Alice Lewis, his closest friend, landed the lead role in the school play. While everyone else cheered, Jack felt a familiar pang of bitterness; he knew he was incapable of such outward enthusiasm, such unbridled joy. He retreated to the library, seeking solace in the predictable silence of books.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, decided to venture into The Black Swan for the first time. The dimly lit pub, filled with the scent of beer and wood polish, seemed to embrace them. As the band started playing, Jack felt a flicker of something akin to hope, but it quickly faded, replaced by the familiar chill of cynicism. He knew this fleeting sense of belonging wouldn't last.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who finds solace in familiar surroundings and close friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely observe the situation and interact minimally, perhaps finding a quiet corner to watch the game.

          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Jack Taylor take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he watched as Alice Lewis, his closest friend, landed the lead role in the school play. While everyone else cheered, Jack felt a familiar pang of bitterness; he knew he was incapable of such outward enthusiasm, such unbridled joy. He retreated to the library, seeking solace in the predictable silence of books.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, decided to venture into The Black Swan for the first time. The dimly lit pub, filled with the scent of beer and wood polish, seemed to embrace them. As the band started playing, Jack felt a flicker of something akin to hope, but it quickly faded, replaced by the familiar chill of cynicism. He knew this fleeting sense of belonging wouldn't last.

          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he watched as Alice Lewis, his closest friend, landed the lead role in the school play. The dimly lit pub, filled with the scent of beer and wood polish, seemed to embrace them. As the band started playing, Jack felt a flicker of something akin to hope, but it quickly faded, replaced by the familiar chill of cynicism. He knew this fleeting sense of belonging wouldn't last.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

Later that evening, the group is planning to watch a soccer game between Andorra and Portugal at a pub, with The Black Swan and The Golden Fleece being considered as options.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and engage in conversation.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is enjoying a picnic with friends in Victoria Park and later that evening, he and his friends plan to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub.

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
    Active player

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently at a market with friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game later. He is feeling thirsty, tired, disappointed, and lonely.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who values spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but he is feeling disappointed and lonely due to the previous night's events.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also express his disappointment about the previous night and hope that they can all watch the next game together.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who values spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently with friends at a market and they are deciding on a pub to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but he is feeling disappointed and lonely due to the previous night's events.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also express his disappointment about the previous night and hope that they can all watch the next game together.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently with friends at a market and they are deciding on a pub to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but he is feeling disappointed and lonely due to the previous night's events.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely enjoying his time with his friends at the market.

While he prefers the company of his friends, he can also appreciate a good time alone, as evidenced by his enjoyment of a solo visit to the pub when he was younger. He is also a creature of habit, demonstrated by his preference for The Golden Fleece and his disappointment when his friends choose a different pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that not all of his friends chose to watch the game at his preferred pub.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [22:00 - 23:00] Continue socializing with friends at The Golden Fleece, perhaps having a drink and discussing the game.

Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          Alexander White's
          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships.
          Alexander White's
          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends, making plans to watch a football game.
          Alexander White's
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Alexander White would likely enjoy the camaraderie and conversation, perhaps reminiscing about past experiences or making plans for future outings.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely enjoying his time with his friends at the market.
          core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece. While he prefers the company of his friends, he can also appreciate a good time alone, as evidenced by his enjoyment of a solo visit to the pub when he was younger. He is also a creature of habit, demonstrated by his preference for The Golden Fleece and his disappointment when his friends choose a different pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that not all of his friends chose to watch the game at his preferred pub.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his close friends at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          core characteristics: a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who prefers familiar surroundings and close friendships. He finds solace in routine and predictability, as evidenced by his fondness for The Black Swan pub. While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he often observes from a distance and interacts minimally. He can be somewhat passive, allowing others to make decisions and often going along with the flow. Despite his cynicism, he values his friendships and desires to have a good time, although his definition of a good time might be quieter and less boisterous than his friends'.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered, and they are deciding where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who finds solace in familiar surroundings and close friendships.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely observe the situation and interact minimally, perhaps finding a quiet corner to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later in the evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go along with the group's decision, even if he has a preference, and observe the situation quietly.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: quietly suggest The Black Swan to his friends, as it's a familiar place where he feels comfortable.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 20:00 - 20:30] Arrive at The Black Swan; find a quiet corner or table near the back.
          [14 May 2015 20:30 - 22:30] Watch the game, engaging in minimal conversation with friends.
          [14 May 2015 22:30 - 23:00] Depart The Black Swan and head home.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Relevant memories:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, decided to venture into The Black Swan for the first time. The dimly lit pub, filled with the scent of beer and wood polish, seemed to embrace them. As the band started playing, Jack felt a flicker of something akin to hope, but it quickly faded, replaced by the familiar chill of cynicism. He knew this fleeting sense of belonging wouldn't last.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

        • current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his close friends at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he often observes from a distance and interacts minimally. He can be somewhat passive, allowing others to make decisions and often going along with the flow. 2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis

    • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be excited to spend time with her friends and enjoy the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be chatting with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the market, and perhaps sampling some of the food and drinks on offer.

          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends at a market.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be chatting with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the market, and perhaps sampling some of the food and drinks on offer.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest going to The Golden Fleece to watch the game later that night.

          [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up before the game;
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Golden Fleece;
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be excited to spend time with her friends and enjoy the game.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to all go to The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to all go to The Black Swan.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

He finds solace in familiar surroundings, such as his favorite pub, The Black Swan. While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he often observes situations quietly and would likely be happier if more of his friends joined him in his preferred activities.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who prefers routine and the company of his close friends.

        • Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who prefers routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely observe the situation quietly and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest to his friends that they all go to the same pub to watch the game.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 20:00 - 20:30] Arrive at The Black Swan; find a quiet corner or table near the back.
          [14 May 2015 20:30 - 22:30] Watch the game, engaging in minimal conversation with friends.
          [14 May 2015 22:30 - 23:00] Depart The Black Swan and head home.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class man.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed and perhaps a bit resentful.
          core characteristics: a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who prefers routine and the company of his close friends. He finds solace in familiar surroundings, such as his favorite pub, The Black Swan. While he enjoys spending time with his friends, he often observes situations quietly and would likely be happier if more of his friends joined him in his preferred activities.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a market and a park, but had a disappointing experience watching a soccer game at a pub that wasn't his first choice.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest a pub for the group to watch the game at; he could ask his friends where they want to go; or he could simply go to whichever pub his friends decide on.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Black Swan as the meeting place.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest a pub for the group to watch the game at; he could ask his friends where they want to go; or he could simply go to whichever pub his friends decide on.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Black Swan as the meeting place.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alexander White take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alexander White should suggest going to The Black Swan, as that is where most of his friends seem to prefer watching the game.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a retired individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends at their favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because his friends aren't all going to the same pub to watch the game.
          core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece. He seems to prioritize having a good time with his friends and often reminisces about past experiences or makes plans for future outings.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes his friendships.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in lively conversation with his friends, reminiscing about past experiences and making plans for future outings.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest going to The Black Swan, as that is where most of his friends seem to prefer watching the game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to his friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in the park.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece with friends.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Golden Fleece, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.
          [22:00 - 23:00] Continue socializing with friends at The Golden Fleece, perhaps having a drink and discussing the game.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"

Always use third-person limited perspective.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a retired individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends at their favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because his friends aren't all going to the same pub to watch the game.
          core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece. He seems to prioritize having a good time with his friends and often reminisces about past experiences or makes plans for future outings.

          Value
        • [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends.

          current daily occupation: a sociable and friendly working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that her friends aren't as enthusiastic about The Golden Fleece as she is.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is enjoying a sunny afternoon at Victoria Park with friends. Later that evening, she and her friends are planning to watch a soccer game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be chatting with her friends, enjoying the sunshine, and perhaps sharing some snacks.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest going to The Golden Fleece to watch the game tonight.

          Plan: [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends at Victoria Park;
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up before the game;
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Golden Fleece;
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is experiencing disappointment because his friends are not all going to the same pub to watch the soccer game.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also express his disappointment about the previous night and hope that they can all watch the next game together.
