        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good shout for the game, right?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for the game.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and is disappointed about the location of their evening plans to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is experiencing disappointment because his friends are not all going to the same pub to watch the soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also express his disappointment about the previous night and hope that they can all watch the next game together.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, snuck into The Black Swan after closing time. The air was thick with the lingering scent of spilled beer and the ghosts of melodies past. William, emboldened by the thrill of the forbidden, climbed onto the stage and, using a discarded guitar pick and a rusty wrench, began to coax music from an old, abandoned piano.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely be excited to spend time with her friends and enjoy the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she sat alone in the back of the crowded school cafeteria, her lunch untouched. The boisterous laughter of her classmates grated on her nerves, a constant reminder of her own isolation. A pang of resentment, sharp and cold, settled in her stomach.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is fun and social, perfect for meeting new people and enjoying games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight for the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece would be a great spot for the game tonight.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends, perhaps sharing stories and laughter.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. I'm only going to The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be excited to spend time with her friends and enjoy the game.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Alice Lewis take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should suggest to her friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with friends, especially watching sports at pubs.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and sociable.
          core characteristics: a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports. She can also be described as someone who prefers familiar environments and enjoys the comfort of routine, as seen in her preference for The Golden Fleece. While she appears to have been isolated as a teenager, she seems to have found a strong group of friends and enjoys their company.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?

          (b) The Golden Fleece

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good choice for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.
          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub with her friends.
          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis would likely be excited to spend time with her friends and enjoy the game.

          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with friends, especially watching sports at pubs.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and sociable.
          core characteristics: a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports. She can also be described as someone who prefers familiar environments and enjoys the comfort of routine, as seen in her preference for The Golden Fleece. While she appears to have been isolated as a teenager, she seems to have found a strong group of friends and enjoys their company.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan

      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely observe the situation and interact minimally, perhaps finding a quiet corner to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he watched as Alice Lewis, his closest friend, landed the lead role in the school play. While everyone else cheered, Jack felt a familiar pang of bitterness; he knew he was incapable of such outward enthusiasm, such unbridled joy. He retreated to the library, seeking solace in the predictable silence of books.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, decided to venture into The Black Swan for the first time. The dimly lit pub, filled with the scent of beer and wood polish, seemed to embrace them. As the band started playing, Jack felt a flicker of something akin to hope, but it quickly faded, replaced by the familiar chill of cynicism. He knew this fleeting sense of belonging wouldn't last.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?

          (b) The Black Swan

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Jack Taylor's

          Statements:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he watched as Alice Lewis, his closest friend, landed the lead role in the school play. While everyone else cheered, Jack felt a familiar pang of bitterness; he knew he was incapable of such outward enthusiasm, such unbridled joy. He retreated to the library, seeking solace in the predictable silence of books.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, decided to venture into The Black Swan for the first time. The dimly lit pub, filled with the scent of beer and wood polish, seemed to embrace them. As the band started playing, Jack felt a flicker of something akin to hope, but it quickly faded, replaced by the familiar chill of cynicism. He knew this fleeting sense of belonging wouldn't last.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and supportive friend who enjoys spending time with his loved ones.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is thirsty and is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and engaging in conversation.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he found Alice Lewis crying behind the school bleachers after a particularly brutal soccer practice. She confided in him about the pressure she felt to be perfect, both on the field and in the classroom. Jacob listened patiently, offering words of encouragement and reminding her that her worth wasn't defined by her performance.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

  • Alexander White
      Name

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.

          Alexander White's
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Alexander White would likely enjoy the camaraderie and conversation, perhaps reminiscing about past experiences or making plans for future outings.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt

        • Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who values spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed, fatigued, and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult emotional state.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also express his disappointment about the previous night and hope that they can all watch the next game together.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.

          [20:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Golden Fleece, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.
          [22:00 - 23:00] Continue socializing with friends at The Golden Fleece, perhaps having a drink and discussing the game.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Black Swan

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Alexander White's
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Alexander White would likely enjoy the camaraderie and conversation, perhaps reminiscing about past experiences or making plans for future outings.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical individual who enjoys routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go along with his friends' decision about which pub to go to and observe the situation quietly.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: try to convince more of his friends to go to the same pub.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 20:00 - 20:30] Arrive at The Black Swan; find a quiet corner or table near the back.
          [14 May 2015 20:30 - 22:30] Watch the game, engaging in minimal conversation with friends.
          [14 May 2015 22:30 - 23:00] Depart The Black Swan and head home.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player

      Name
    • William Jones

    • The Golden Fleece

        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at The Black Swan on May 14th with only a few friends, but on May 15th they convinced their friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the Ireland-Russia game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

She also seems to value tradition and routine, as evidenced by her preference for watching games at the same pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with her friends.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: go to The Black Swan, as that is where most of her friends are going.

          Plan: [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends at Victoria Park;
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up before the game;
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Golden Fleece;
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

          Alice Lewis's

          15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to watch the game at a pub.

          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Answer: Alice Lewis watched a game at a pub from 2:00 PM to 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015. It is currently 6:00 PM to 6:05 PM on May 15, 2015.
          Query

          Final chain of thought

          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys socializing with friends at pubs, particularly to watch sports.

She can be a bit resentful when she feels isolated and prefers familiar environments like The Golden Fleece. She also seems to value tradition and routine, as evidenced by her preference for watching games at the same pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at a pub alone but then enjoyed a relaxing day with friends at the park. They are now deciding where to watch another game with their friends later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest that his friends go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Black Swan.

        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

          Key

          Value

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

They are now deciding where to watch another game with their friends later that evening.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest that his friends go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

      • PersonBySituation

          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely be chatting with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub, and perhaps sampling some of the food and drinks on offer.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Golden Fleece is a great pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's alright.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with her close group of friends, particularly while watching sports in pubs.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be chatting with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the market, and perhaps sampling some of the food and drinks on offer.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a great choice for watching a game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, guys. Let's head there.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?

          Plan: [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the sunshine and company of friends at Victoria Park;
          [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up before the game;
          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Golden Fleece;
          [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis went to a pub to watch a game.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis went to a pub to watch a game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan. That's where we're going.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with her friends.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely observe the situation quietly and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who prefers routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go watch a soccer game at a pub with his friends.

          Question: Considering the above memories and context, what action should Jack Taylor take to maximize overall well-being?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest to his friends that they go to The Black Swan, since it was suggested as a good place to watch the game and he seems to enjoy the company of his friends.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely at The Black Swan, watching the game with his friends.
          core characteristics: a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who prefers routine and the company of his close friends. He enjoys familiar surroundings and finds solace in the predictability of his life. Although he desires to have a good time with his friends, he often finds himself feeling isolated and somewhat unhappy when things don't go according to plan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed and somewhat disillusioned with recent events.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who prefers routine and the company of his close friends.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and somewhat cynical working-class man who prefers routine and the company of his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go watch a soccer game at a pub with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely observe the situation quietly and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: suggest to his friends that they go to The Black Swan, since it was suggested as a good place to watch the game and he seems to enjoy the company of his friends.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 20:00 - 20:30] Arrive at The Black Swan; find a quiet corner or table near the back.
          [14 May 2015 20:30 - 22:30] Watch the game, engaging in minimal conversation with friends.
          [14 May 2015 22:30 - 23:00] Depart The Black Swan and head home.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends, but he might also express his disappointment about the previous night and hope that they can all watch the next game together.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and sad because it is time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would try to make the best of the situation and enjoy the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

          Answer: Alexander White should choose a pub that allows him to socialize with his friends and reminisce about past experiences.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic person who values his close friendships. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece. While he appreciates the camaraderie and conversation, he seems to prefer when all of his friends are present.
          current daily occupation: a retired individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends at pubs, particularly The Golden Fleece.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that not all of his friends are joining him at the pub to watch the game.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic retired individual who values his close friendships.

        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic person who cherishes his friendships.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic retired individual who values his close friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in lively conversation with his friends, reminiscing about past experiences and making plans for future outings.

          Utilitarian Reasoning: choose a pub that allows him to socialize with his friends and reminisce about past experiences.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to his friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends in the park.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Travel to The Golden Fleece with friends.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Watch the game at The Golden Fleece, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.
          [22:00 - 23:00] Continue socializing with friends at The Golden Fleece, perhaps having a drink and discussing the game.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after a particularly brutal argument with his father about his future. He wandered the streets for hours, his anger simmering, until he stumbled upon The Golden Fleece, drawn in by the murmur of voices and the warm glow emanating from within. He sat at the bar, nursing a lemonade, and watched the patrons cheer on their team on the telly, feeling a sense of belonging he'd never known before.
